summary:
The Security Council,
 
Recalling previous resolutions on the situation in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, 
Noting the Secretary-General's letter of 14 August 2000, 
Reaffirming the sovereignty and territorial integrity of the Democratic Republic of the Congo, 
Reaffirming commitment to the Lusaka Ceasefire Agreement, 
Noting with concern MONUC's restricted deployment due to lack of access, security and cooperation, 
Reaffirming will to work with parties to create conditions for MONUC deployment, 
Appreciating States' willingness to provide military units, 
Calling on parties to lift obstacles to MONUC deployment and operations, 

1. Decides to extend MONUC's mandate until 15 October 2000; 
2. Emphasizes this extension allows time for diplomatic activities and Council reflection on MONUC's future mandate; 
3. Requests the Secretary-General to report by 21 September 2000 on progress and make recommendations; 
4. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
